main_definition: los is a Spanish word that can function as an article 'the' or be part of various idioms and phrases.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The definite article 'the', used before masculine singular nouns in Spanish
Part of the idiom 'perder los estribos' meaning to lose one's temper or composure
meanings_and_examples.example: Cuando escucho ese ruido, pierdo totalmente los estribos.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Part of the phrase 'pasarlo bien' which means to enjoy oneself thoroughly
meanings_and_examples.example: Estuvimos de fiesta toda la noche y realmente lo pasamos bien.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in sports context, specifically football (soccer), it can mean the goalkeeper or a group of players who defend the goal ('los guardametas' - 'the goalkeepers').
meanings_and_examples.example: Los jugadores del equipo se concentraron en proteger el arco.
